question: Which two countries share the location of the "Halti Mountain Peak"?
explanation: Norway and Finland share the location of the Halti Mountain Peak which is located at its border. It is a "fell" which is a high and barren landscape feature such as the mountain range or moor-covered hills. The highest point of the fell on the Finnish side is at 1324 meters above sea level and thus the highest point in the country. The highest point in Finland is known as Halditsohkka at the border of Norway. The peak proper is not in Finland. The highest mountain whose peak is in Finland is Ridnitsohkka.
